page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: Since this area is in the commuter belt around London this influences farming, which can be subdivided into: 1 {CEREALS}- The main type of farming, the cereals grown being wheat and Barley. The farmers use oil-seed rape as a break crop and to take advantage of Common Market subsidies. A typical cereal farm is St Agnells Farm, it has 178 acres of cereals and 17 acres of grazing land. It grows wheat, barley and oats and employs 2 people. The farm is highly mechanised and the grain is stored in a 40 ton silo - a common feature in the landscape. Large amounts of pesticide are used to ensure maximum harvest. The farmer keeps beef cattle on the grazing land in the valley where it is too wet for cereals. He grows oil seed rape as a break crop on his cereal land.
